results.title: Elephants
results.creator_credit: Mel Waskin, Bill Walker and Coronet Films
results.brief_description: Shows the daily activities of elephants, such as eating leaves from trees, drinking and bathing in water. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Elephant theatre (K)
results.creator_credit: Sabrina Schmid and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: One man has built a little theatre which he can hold in the palm of his hand. It reveals a world of its own. Yet there remains one dream to be fulfilled: that some elephants will come to live in it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sabrina Schmid and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School

results.title: Elephant theatre
results.brief_description: Like an Indian pod filled with tiny ivory elephants, the imaginary hand-size theatre fills with elephants, to the delight of the man who built it.
results.description: Like an Indian pod filled with tiny ivory elephants, the imaginary hand-size theatre fills with elephants, to the delight of the man who built it.

results.title: Elephant baby
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of a baby elephant from its first day in the jungle, through many weeks of training, to the day it joins a working force of elephants in a lumber camp. Photographed in Mysore, India, the film gives an account of the daily activities of working elephants and of the people who train them, including the shooting of a tiger which came too close to the camp for comfort.
results.description: This film tells the story of a baby elephant from its first day in the jungle, through many weeks of training, to the day it joins a working force of elephants in a lumber camp. results.title: Elephant
results.creator_credit: Peter Chermayeff and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Shows without commentary the African elephant on its daily routine of foraging, dusting, playing, roaming anddrinking from a waterhole. Illustrates the elephants physical characteristics. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Elements of tempering, normalizing and annealing
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Audio Productions and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Engineering heat treatment of steel”.
Shows how steel is tempered; how the structure, toughness and hardness of a plain carbon steel change at progressive tempering stages; how steel is normalised, by furnace heating and subsequent cooling in still air; how steel is annealed and how such an annealing process relieves stresses in steel castings and softens the metal.
results.creator_credit_for_label: F.E. Brooker, Audio Productions and United States. Office of Education
results.description:

results.title: Elements of surface hardening
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Audio Productions and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Engineering heat treatment of steel”.
Shows how steel is pack and gas carburised; how a thin, hard case is obtained by cyaniding; how nitriding is used to obtain a very hard case; and how steel is flame and induction hardened.

results.title: Elements of hardening
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Audio Productions, United States. Federal Security Agency and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Engineering heat treatment of steel”.
Shows how steel is quench-hardened; how the structures and hardness of steels with different carbon content change at progressive quench-hardening stages; how an iron-carbon diagram is constructed and what information may be derived from an analysis of such a diagram.
results.creator_credit_for_label: F.E. Brooker, Audio Productions, United States. Federal Security Agency and United States. Office of Education

results.title: Elements of electrical circuits
results.creator_credit: Morris Meisner and ERPI Classroom Films
